text:
IN People ON 24 Feb, 2017 He Had The Most Extensive Face Transplant In History And Looks This Way Now Share on twitter Follow Us On 
Accidents happen all the time, but not everyone experiences a severe injury that results in a drastic disfigurement. It takes strength and fortitude to climb from the depths of despair and rise to achieve our full potential to continue life with dignity and inspiration. 
Mitchell Hunter faced the same challenge when he was electrocuted with 10,000 volts. This is his story...! He Had The Most Extensive Face Transplant In History And Looks This Way Now 754 396 
In 2001, Mitchell Hunter was riding in the passenger seat of a car as it hit an electric pole. Mitchell was struck with 10,000 volts of electricity for nearly five minutes as he pulled the female driver to safety. At Least He Didn't Feel A Thing 
He survived the ordeal but suffered a severe facial disfigurement and a lost leg. Luckily, he didn't feel a thing. "People tell me I'm fortunate that I don't remember [the accident] because it would probably be a lot of pain." Everyone Stared At His Face via 
He found it difficult to get used to the way people would look at him now. "Imagine walking into a room and, like, falling and everybody noticing," he explained. "That's how it was every time I walked in a room because of the way my face looked." Doctors Perform Full Face Transplant 
When people stare, he tends to brush it off and focus on whether or not his beard is trimmed nicely. "Hot, cold, pain, tickle, rubbing my beard, someone kissing my face, I can feel everything," Mitchell explains. Renewed Self-Confidence 
His new look did add a renewed sense of confidence, "It's a lot easier to go out in public now, I will tell you that," he said. The Experience Made Him Stronger via 
Mitchell's experience suffering through the depressing ordeal has allowed him to build his strength back up. "I look back on it as something that made me stronger," he explained. "I mean, yeah, I'd like to have my leg and my face back, but without that happening, I wouldn't be who I am today." Only Three Surgeries Of Its Kind 
Mitchell was the third person to receive a complete face transplant. The first man was Dallas Wiens, who electrocuted himself while painting his church. Loved this? Spread it out then
